meanings.definition: To make a light, sharp, ringing sound, as of metal being struck.
meanings.sent1: I heard the metal tink as I dropped the spoon.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith would often tink on the anvil in his workshop.
meanings.sent3: The little fairy would tink on the tiny bells to spread magic.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter tinked like a delicate wind chime in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The rain tinked softly on the window, lulling me to sleep.

meanings.definition: A light, sharp, ringing sound, as of metal being struck.
meanings.sent1: The tink of the wind chime filled the garden with music.
meanings.sent2: The old clock made a familiar tink every hour.
meanings.sent3: The tiny bell's tink made the kitten curious.
meanings.sent4: The tink of the spoon hitting the bowl signaled dinner time.
meanings.sent5: The distant tink of the hammer echoed through the valley.
